metadata.title: Create End-to-End User Stories Guide for Healio Workflows
metadata.prd_reference: Core clinic workflows: onboarding, booking, appointments, patient records, billing, reminders

context.background: User requested a detailed `USER-STORIES.md` with step-by-step user journeys (create clinic account, book appointment, check appointments, etc.) including exact pages and what to click.

design_constraints.constraint: Document realistic Healio flows using current route names and visible CTA/button labels.
Be explicit about local vs production setup assumptions (auth, demo data, Supabase configuration).
Use actionable steps and expected outcomes, not only narrative descriptions.

instruction.step: Create `healio/USER-STORIES.md` with detailed end-to-end user stories for clinic owner, front desk, and patient/public booking flows.
Include exact routes, buttons/links to click, expected results, and troubleshooting notes for common auth/email issues.
Cover at minimum: clinic account creation, login, settings setup, public booking, checking appointments, patient chart access, and billing/payment flow.

validation_checklist.check: Guide references current Healio routes and labels (e.g., `/signup`, `/login`, `/settings`, `/book/[slug]`, `/appointments`, `/billing`).
Guide is step-by-step and detailed enough for manual QA/UAT execution.
File is committed and task XML is updated/renamed `DONE_`.

acceptance_criteria.criterion: `healio/USER-STORIES.md` exists and provides detailed click-by-click user stories for major Healio workflows.
Task XML is updated with evidence and renamed `DONE_` on completion.

output_spec.commit_message: docs(healio): add end-to-end user stories guide

execution_tracking.verification_command: Route/button label verification via rg/sed across auth, booking, appointments, patients, billing, settings components
execution_tracking.verification_notes: Created detailed end-to-end user stories guide with click-by-click instructions for clinic owner, front desk, and patient workflows. Included local setup assumptions, auth options (password/magic link/Google), public booking, appointments, patient chart, billing, payment, troubleshooting, and suggested test order. Labels/routes were cross-checked against current UI code.
